user_request: Write a Shakespearean sonnet comparing a lover to a summer day.
final_poem:
Upon my heart, thy love doth brightly shine;  
Like golden sun that summons dawn to day—    
Thy warmth in every whisper of sweet time,   
Doth like a summer' endlessly splay and play:       In thee I find delight as clear  
As the azure sky from which gentle breezes blow. My love for you is constant; just so does each breath bring forth fresh zephyrs to dance upon thine eyes with ephemeral touch of joy—a summer's day in every beat, a sunrise within thy gaze and dusk retreat:    
In thee I find delight as clear  
As the azure sky from which gentle breezes blow. My love for you is constant; just so does each breath bring forth fresh zephyrs to dance upon thine eyes with ephemeral touch of joy—a summer's day in every beat, a sunrise within thy gaze and dusk retreat:    
Thy heart beats as the tide 'neath lunar sway; its rhythm like waves on shore    In thee I find delight. As constant stars that watch o’er nightly scene   Thou art mine eternal summer, fair— my love for you is evergreen and free of frost:    
Thy heart beats as the tide 'neath lunar sway; its rhythm like waves on shore    In thee I find delight. As constant stars that watch o’er nightly scene   Thou art mine eternal summer, fair— my love for you is evergreen and free of frost:    
And thus we waltz in time's sweet passage through the years; thy laughter rings as bells at morn when sun doth climb. My heart with joy it does ascend    In thee I find delight, a summer day reborn— my love for you endures beyond measure and all climes:    
And thus we waltz in time's sweet passage through the years; thy laughter rings as bells at morn when sun doth climb. My heart with joy it does ascend    In thee I find delight, a summer day reborn— my love for you endures beyond measure and all climes:    
Thine eyes hold sparks of fire to warm the soul; thy smile is ray that pierces ice   When winter’s chill in cruel fashion comes. Yet even then thou shalt not fade    In thee I find delight, no fearful snow doth dare defile— my love for you remains as evergreen and bright:    
Thine eyes hold sparks of fire to warm the soul; thy smile is ray that pierces ice   When winter’s chill in cruel fashion comes. Yet even then thou shalt not fade    In thee I find delight, no fearful snow doth dare defile— my love for you remains as evergreen and bright:    
In every season' s turn our hearts entwine; such grace 'tis rare to behold   As summer sun that kisses earth with warmth divine. My heart in thy embrace finds peace at last    In thee I find delight, a blissful summers’ day untaught— my love for you as constant and vast:    
In every season's turn our hearts entwine; such grace 'tis rare to behold   As summer sun that kisses earth with warmth divine. My heart in thy embrace finds peace at last    In thee I find delight, a blissful summers’ day untaught— my love for you as constant and vast:    
Let none deceive or turn from me; like the steadfast ever-glowing rose   Thy beauty shines eternal in mine affection's throne. My heart with thee forever shall comply    In all of time, no cruel frost can claim thy glee— my love for you endures as constant and pure:    
Let none deceive or turn from me; like the steadfast ever-glowing rose   Thy beauty shines eternal in mine affection's throne. My heart with thee forever shall comply    In all of time, no cruel frost can claim thy glee— my love for you endures as constant and pure:    
To walk within your presence is to know the art Of living life without a single strand astray; Thy essence wraps 'round me like verdant vines that cling   To ancient oaks, strong yet swayed by summer's play. My heart with thee forever shall comply    In all of time and through every turn or twist— my love for you as constant is the sunset sky:    
To walk within your presence is to know the art Of living life without a single strand astray; Thy essence wraps 'round me like verdant vines that cling   To ancient oaks, strong yet swayed by summer's play. My heart with thee forever shall comply    In all of time and through every turn or twist— my love for you as constant is the sunset sky:    0
